hook.text: Without regulation, rivers catch fire. The Cuyahoga River burned 13 times before the US created the EPA.

buildup.text: Regulation sets rules for businesses and industries to protect public safety, health, and welfare.

discovery.text: After the 2008 crisis, deregulation got the blame. Too few rules let banks gamble with savings.

twist.text: Too much regulation stifles growth. Too little invites disaster. The balance is always political.

climax.text: Industries often write their own rules through lobbying. The regulated capture the regulators.

punchline.text: Regulation protects the public â€” unless the powerful write the rules.

quiz.question: What is 'regulatory capture'?
options: When industries control the agencies meant to regulate them
When regulations are written by judges
